dmTitle.infoName: Quantum Spar Sensing System (QSS) — Description and Principles

displayText.simplePara: Applicable when QSS is installed on the forward spar (config option AAA-57-QSS-FS).

levelledPara.title: System Overview
levelledPara.para: Quantum Sensorial Skin (QSS) is formed by Quantum Spar Sensors in a Quantum Superposition Setting. For the wing forward spar box it operates as a Quantum Spar Setting, embedding a high-density array along primary load paths to interrogate lattice stress, bond integrity, and micro-void formation.
QSS supports amplification (weak-signal enhancement) and discretization (collapse to quantized health states) modes, selectable by configuration or runtime logic.

levelledPara.title: Architecture
levelledPara.para: Elements: (1) quantum spare sensor arrays (N+2 redundancy in critical zones), (2) superposition engine (coherence, shielding/thermal control), (3) amplification/discretization module with adaptive thresholds, and (4) controller node interfacing to the aircraft data backbone.
Deployment: embedded in composite layups and at reinforced metallic joints; typical depth ≤5 mm; shielded optical/electrical feed-throughs; lightning protection maintained.

levelledPara.title: Data and Schemas
levelledPara.para: Crack detection payloads must validate against: Crack Event Schema. The schema defines event identity, location model, detection method (incl. QSS quantum fields), severity, actions, validation, provenance and attachments.
